title: Cannot send emails.  Client Host Rejected
content:
Fora number of weeks, i have been unable to send emails. The problem just appeared suddenly and does not appear related to any updates or my security settings. When trying to send, i get an error message: "Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: <unknown{202.172.111.110}>: Client host rejected: Access denied. Please check the message recipient "xxx@xxx.com" and try again."

I have seen others with the same issue, but no replies with a fix. Thanks

title: Changed e-mail provider and now can't access old emails
content:
I have changed web hosting provider and now have new IMAP/SMTP server details (same e-mail address "user@domain.com"). I have created a new e-mail account in Thunderbird Beta with the new details and this works fine.

However, the existing e-mail account for "user@domain.com" which is using the old IMAP/SMTP details has thousands of e-mails previously downloaded. Some of these e-mails are still readable in Thunderbird Beta but the majority now say "Go Online to View This Message" in the preview pane. I no longer have access the the old web host.

If I look in the profile directory for this account, it looks like the e-mail is there. Is there a way of copying these e-mails to the new e-mail account?

Many thanks
creator: filmona

title: Thunderbird with exchange email account - email content wiped
content:
When I move or copy an email from one Exchange account to another the content of the email is wiped (my other non-Exchange accounts are all fine). It happens on all my devices one running Windows 10 and one running Windows 11. It happens across all versions of Thunderbird (have re-installed etc). It started occurring on 26-Sep-24. Have been in correspondence with Boenex (re: OWL) since then but dialogue getting nowhere.

I have been using Tbird for 10 years and really like the program. I am having to start using Outlook, which I dislike. If it can’t be fixed then I will be forced to abandon Thunderbird altogether and stop my donations. I don’t know where to go from here. Is anyone able to point me in the right direction?
creator: philipkassanis

title: email verzenden met Thunderbird
content:
Nadat ik op 26 en 27 december mijn HP Pavilion Windows 11 naar Windows 10 gedowngraded heb (omdat ik met Windows 11 niet meer kon printen) en misschien ook nadat Thunderbird op 29 december een upgrade heeft geinstalleerd, kan ik met Thunderbird geen email meer versturen, ook niet na tijdelijk itschakelen van de Windows firewall, maar nog wel ontvangen. Op dezelfde computer werkt kpn webmail zonder problemen. Wat kan er aan de hand zijn?

Mijn instellingen voor de uitgaande server zijn de volgende: beschrijving: kpnmail.nl servernaam: smtp.kpnmail.nl poort: 587 (i.p.v. standaard 465) verbindingsbeveiliging: SSL/TLS authenticatiemethode: geen gebruikersnaam: bruntvello1

Graag hulp of advies, Met vriendelijke groet, Ewout Brunt

I resolved that - I hope - but the file I was trying to send unsuccessfully was also flagged by Norton when I copied it from one computer to another here. Does Thunderbird interact with Norton in this way? Or do you think maybe the web site that I use for my email service might be responsible..I will ask them this same question also. I know you can't speak for anybody but Thunderbird, I am just trying to narrow this down. Well, happy new year............. Thanks everyone!

title: Text size when reading or composing messages
content: Hi, I'm using TB version 128, been a TB user for many years and contribute money regulaly to TB since I love the software and see it as valuable. But trying to use it on my laptop that I bought over a year ago with a hi-resolution monitor is frustrating. I've read all the related posts here about how to "fix" this as well as anything I could find online, tried all the settings in TB, but nothing fixes my issue, nor does it for the many, many other users I'm hearing from as I read online about this far too common problem. When I read a new message all is well as far as the size of the text, but when I reply the font is reduced to an unreadable size unless you have the eyes of Superman. Same thing happens when I compose a new message. On each and every message, I have to repeatedly use the CTRL + keys to increase the text size. I have changed the default setting in layout.css.devPixelsPerPx to 1.5, and that helps with the general interface, but has zero effect on the text size issue. I have also tried every "fix" listed in this support site as well as many others (Reddit, etc.), and nothing will fix this annoying issue. I want to compose or read ALL my messages in the same readable text size, and I can't believe that Thunderbird's developers can't correct this simple problem. Does anyone have any idea how to set the default text and get it to "stick" vs reverting to tiny text?
creator: ronniebolling

title: Stop daily emails from a company
content:
I once bought an item from a company by the name of Autumnook Since then everyday I get an email for some bunch of products they want to sell, of no interest to me. There is an Unsubscribe on the bottom of each mail, but it has no effect.

The only email is the 'reply' address support@autumnook.com I have emailed many times - you get an automated 'we will respond within 2 working days' .. and nothing else. On their website the only contact listed is the same support@autumnook.com

Any suggestions how I can get these mails stopped  ?
